Header.Info: Performance Monitoring Metrics for Intel(R) Xeon(R) 6 Processor with E-cores0

Metrics.BriefDescription: CPU operating frequency (in GHz)
Uncore operating frequency in GHz
Percentage of time spent in the active CPU power state C0
Cycles per instruction retired; indicating how much time each executed instruction took; in units of cycles.
Ratio of number of requests missing L2 cache (includes code+data+rfo w/ prefetches) to the total number of completed instructions
Memory read that miss the last level cache (LLC) addressed to local DRAM as a percentage of total memory read accesses, does not include LLC prefetches.
Memory reads that miss the last level cache (LLC) addressed to remote DRAM as a percentage of total memory read accesses, does not include LLC prefetches.
DDR memory read bandwidth (MB/sec)
DDR memory write bandwidth (MB/sec)
DDR memory bandwidth (MB/sec)
Intel(R) Ultra Path Interconnect (UPI) data transmit bandwidth (MB/sec)
Load operations retired per instruction
Store operations retired per instruction

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_L1D demand data read hits per instr
Metrics.BriefDescription: Ratio of number of demand load requests hitting in L1 data cache to the total number of completed instructions

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_L1-I code read misses (w/ prefetches) per instr
Metrics.BriefDescription: Ratio of number of code read requests missing in L1 instruction cache (includes prefetches) to the total number of completed instructions

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_L2 demand data read hits per instr
Metrics.BriefDescription: Ratio of number of completed demand load requests hitting in L2 cache to the total number of completed instructions
Ratio of number of completed data read request missing L2 cache to the total number of completed instructions
Ratio of number of data read requests missing last level core cache (includes demand w/ prefetches) to the total number of completed instructions
Ratio of number of code read requests missing last level core cache (includes demand w/ prefetches) to the total number of completed instructions

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_Average LLC demand data read miss latency (in ns)
Metrics.BriefDescription: Average latency of a last level cache (LLC) demand data read miss (read memory access) in nano seconds

Ratio of number of completed page walks (for all page sizes) caused by a code fetch to the total number of completed instructions. This implies it missed in the ITLB (Instruction TLB) and further levels of TLB.

Ratio of number of completed page walks (for 2 megabyte and 4 megabyte page sizes) caused by a code fetch to the total number of completed instructions. This implies it missed in the Instruction Translation Lookaside Buffer (ITLB) and further levels of TLB.
Ratio of number of completed page walks (for all page sizes) caused by demand data loads to the total number of completed instructions. This implies it missed in the DTLB and further levels of TLB.

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_DTLB (2nd level) 2MB large page load MPI
Metrics.BriefDescription: Ratio of number of completed page walks (for 2 megabyte page sizes) caused by demand data loads to the total number of completed instructions. This implies it missed in the Data Translation Lookaside Buffer (DTLB) and further levels of TLB.
Ratio of number of completed page walks (for all page sizes) caused by demand data stores to the total number of completed instructions. This implies it missed in the DTLB and further levels of TLB.
Bandwidth of IO reads that are initiated by end device controllers that are requesting memory from the CPU.
Bandwidth of IO writes that are initiated by end device controllers that are writing memory to the CPU.

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_IO % of inbound reads that miss L3
Metrics.BriefDescription: The percent of inbound reads initiated by IO that miss the L3 cache.

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_IO % of inbound partial writes that miss L3
Metrics.BriefDescription: The percent of inbound partial writes initiated by IO that miss the L3 cache.

Metrics.LegacyName: metric_IO % of inbound full writes that miss L3
Metrics.BriefDescription: The percent of inbound full cache line writes initiated by IO that miss the L3 cache.
Bandwidth of IO reads that are initiated by end device controllers that are requesting memory from the local CPU socket.
Bandwidth of IO reads that are initiated by end device controllers that are requesting memory from a remote CPU socket.
Bandwidth of IO writes that are initiated by end device controllers that are writing memory to the local CPU socket.
Bandwidth of IO writes that are initiated by end device controllers that are writing memory to a remote CPU socket.
Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI) per second sent by the integrated I/O traffic controller (IIO) to System Configuration Controller (Ubox).
Bandwidth (MB/sec) of read requests that miss the last level cache (LLC) and go to local memory.
Bandwidth (MB/sec) of write requests that miss the last level cache (LLC) and go to local memory.
Bandwidth (MB/sec) of read requests that miss the last level cache (LLC) and go to remote memory.
Bandwidth (MB/sec) of write requests that miss the last level cache (LLC) and go to remote memory.
Bandwidth observed by the integrated I/O traffic contoller (IIO) of IO reads that are initiated by end device controllers that are requesting memory from the CPU.
Bandwidth observed by the integrated I/O traffic controller (IIO) of IO writes that are initiated by end device controllers that are writing memory to the CPU.
The average number of cores that are in cstate C0 as observed by the power control unit (PCU).
The average number of cores that are in cstate C6 as observed by the power control unit (PCU).
Bandwidth of inbound IO reads that are initiated by end device controllers that are requesting memory from the CPU and miss the L3 cache.
Bandwidth of inbound IO writes that are initiated by end device controllers that are writing memory to the CPU.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to frontend stalls.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to frontend latency restrictions due to icache misses, itlb misses, branch detection, and resteer limitations.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to instruction cache misses.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to Instruction Table Lookaside Buffer (ITLB) misses.

Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to BACLEARS, which occurs when the Branch Target Buffer (BTB) prediction or lack thereof, was corrected by a later branch predictor in the frontend. Includes BACLEARS due to all branch types including conditional and unconditional jumps, returns, and indirect branches.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to BTCLEARS, which occurs when the Branch Target Buffer (BTB) predicts a taken branch.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to frontend bandwidth restrictions due to decode, predecode, cisc, and other limitations.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to the microcode sequencer (MS).
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to decode stalls.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to wrong predecodes.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not delivered by the frontend due to other common frontend stalls not categorized.

Counts the total number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend because allocation is stalled due to a mispredicted jump or a machine clear. Only issue slots wasted due to fast nukes such as memory ordering nukes are counted. Other nukes are not accounted for. Counts all issue slots blocked during this recovery window including relevant microcode flows and while uops are not yet available in the instruction queue (IQ). Also includes the issue slots that were consumed by the backend but were thrown away because they were younger than the mispredict or machine clear.
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to branch mispredicts

Counts the total number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend because allocation is stalled due to a machine clear (nuke) of any kind including memory ordering and memory disambiguation
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to a machine clear that requires the use of microcode (slow nuke)

Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to a machine clear that does not require the use of microcode, classified as a fast nuke, due to memory ordering, memory disambiguation and memory renaming

Counts the total number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to backend stalls. Note that uops must be available for consumption in order for this event to count. If a uop is not available (IQ is empty), this event will not count
Counts the number of cycles due to backend bound stalls that are bounded by core restrictions and not attributed to an outstanding load or stores, or resource limitation
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to certain allocation restrictions
Counts the number of cycles the core is stalled due to a resource limitation
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to memory reservation stalls in which a scheduler is not able to accept uops

Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to IEC or FPC RAT stalls, which can be due to FIQ or IEC reservation stalls in which the integer, floating point or SIMD scheduler is not able to accept uops
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to the physical register file unable to accept an entry (marble stalls)
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to the reorder buffer being full (ROB stalls)
Counts the number of issue slots that were not consumed by the backend due to scoreboards from the instruction queue (IQ), jump execution unit (JEU), or microcode sequencer (MS)
Counts the number of issue slots that result in retirement slots
Percentage of time that retirement is stalled by the Memory Cluster due to a pipeline stall. See Info.Mem_Exec_Bound
Percentage of time that retirement is stalled due to an L1 miss. See Info.Load_Miss_Bound
Percentage of time that retirement is stalled due to a first level data TLB miss
Percentage of time that allocation and retirement is stalled by the Frontend Cluster due to an Ifetch Miss, either Icache or ITLB Miss. See Info.Ifetch_Bound
Instructions Per Cycle
Cycles Per Instruction
Uops Per Instruction
Floating Point Operations Per Cycle
Instructions per Branch (lower number means higher occurrence rate)
Instruction per (near) call (lower number means higher occurrence rate)
Instructions per Far Branch ( Far Branches apply upon transition from application to operating system, handling interrupts, exceptions) [lower number means higher occurrence rate]
Instructions per retired Branch Misprediction
Instructions per retired conditional Branch Misprediction where the branch was not taken
Instructions per retired conditional Branch Misprediction where the branch was taken
Instructions per retired return Branch Misprediction
Instructions per retired indirect call or jump Branch Misprediction
Instructions per Floating Point (FP) Operation
Instructions per FP Arithmetic Scalar Single-Precision instruction
Instructions per FP Arithmetic Scalar Double-Precision instruction
Instructions per FP Arithmetic AVX/SSE 128-bit instruction
Percentage of all uops which are microcode ops
Percentage of all uops which are FPDiv uops
Percentage of all uops which are IDiv uops
Percentage of all uops which are x87 uops
Instructions per Load
Instructions per Store
Ratio of mem load uops to all uops
Percentage of total non-speculative loads that are splits
Percentage of total non-speculative loads that perform one or more locks
Percentage of total non-speculative loads with a store forward or unknown store address block
Percentage of total non-speculative loads with an address aliasing block
Percentage of Memory Execution Bound due to a second level TLB miss
Percentage of Memory Execution Bound due to a pagewalk
Percentage of Memory Execution Bound due to a store forward address match
Percentage of Memory Execution Bound due to other block cases, such as pipeline conflicts, fences, etc
Percentage of Memory Execution Bound due to a first level data cache miss
Counts the number of cycles the core is stalled due to store buffer full
Counts the number of cycles that the oldest load of the load buffer is stalled at retirement
Counts the number of cycles that the oldest load of the load buffer is stalled at retirement due to a pipeline block
Percentage of memory bound stalls where retirement is stalled due to an L1 miss that hit the L2
Percentage of memory bound stalls where retirement is stalled due to an L1 miss that hit the L3
Percentage of ifetch miss bound stalls, where the ifetch miss hits in the L2
Percentage of ifetch miss bound stalls, where the ifetch miss hits in the L3
Ratio of all branches which mispredict
Ratio between Mispredicted branches and unknown branches
Counts the number of machine clears relative to thousands of instructions retired, due to floating point assists
Counts the number of machine clears relative to thousands of instructions retired, due to page faults
Counts the number of machine clears relative to thousands of instructions retired, due to self-modifying code
Percentage of time that allocation is stalled due to store buffer full
Percentage of time that allocation is stalled due to load buffer full
Percentage of time that allocation is stalled due to memory reservation stations full
Percentage of time that the core is stalled due to a TPAUSE or UMWAIT instruction
Average Frequency Utilization relative nominal frequency
Fraction of cycles spent in Kernel mode
Average CPU Utilization
PerfMon Event Multiplexing accuracy indicator
Giga Floating Point Operations Per Second. Aggregate across all supported options of: FP precisions, scalar and vector instructions, vector-width
